Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Trilenodin (natural AMPs, lasso peptide, lactam; XXJ; UCSB1a; bacteriocins; bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature.Author: Pulliam C, Xue D, Campbell A, Older E, Li J. 2024
Literature.Title: Discovery and Heterologous Expression of Trilenodin, an Antimicrobial Lasso Peptide with a Unique Tri-isoleucine Motif.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (42.86%) toPictuseptin-2I=G: 17%; T: 13%. GRAVY: 0.4; mol Wt: 2551.024; mol formula: C120H193N30O31; mol ex coeff: 7040.Chemical modification:  The amine of the N-terminal glycine forms an amide bond with D9.Activity: active against S. aureus USA300 (MIC 25.3 uM), B. subtilis 168 (MIC 6.3 uM), and K. pneumoniae ATCC 10031 (MIC 6.3 uM).Recombinant production:bacteria:B. subtilis 168: the expression inhibited the growth of this expression bacterium.Est 9/2024
